main event: A civilian observer spotted an unidentified shining silver object over Manning, North Dakota on November 11, 12, and 13, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed for a total of 3 hours, appearing at 12:35 Zulu each day and disappearing over the horizon.
The object was detected on ground radar for a 2-hour period from 23:30 to 02:00.
The object was at a 10-degree angle and traveled in a straight path towards the southeast.
Weather conditions were clear with unlimited visibility during the sightings.
The report indicates the object was likely a contrail from a scheduled military aircraft flight.
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
